title: European Space Agency makes final preparations for inaugural Ariane 6 launch
summary: The first flight of the rocket will carry several payloads unto low Earth orbit for a variety of customers, including NASA. Teams are targeting launch from French Guiana on July 9, 2024, during a window that runs from 3-7 p.m. GFT (2-6 p.m. EDT, 1900-2300 UTC).

title: Four Analog Astronauts Complete 378-Day Practice Mars Mission

title: Low-intensity explosion caused Russian satellite to spew debris
summary: A Russian satellite likely suffered a “low-intensity explosion” that created hundreds of pieces of debris in low Earth orbit, according to one company’s analysis.

title: Sols 4236-4238: One More Time… for Contact Science at Mammoth Lakes
summary: Earth planning date: Friday, July 5, 2024 Curiosity will drive away from the Mammoth Lakes drill location on the second sol of this three-sol weekend plan, but before she does, the team will take the opportunity for one last chance at contact science in this interesting region of the Gediz Vallis deposit. title: Rafale Combat Aircraft Arrive in Kourou to Secure Skies for Ariane 6 Debut
summary: Three Dassault Rafale combat aircraft from the French Air and Space Force arrived in French Guiana on 1 July to secure the skies over the Ariane 6 launch site ahead of the rocket’s inaugural flight. The deployment was announced in a French Ministry of the Armed Forces update stating that the three aircraft from the […]
